oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Cylinder from a Colt revolving rifle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a five shot cylinder from a Colt revolving rifle with two .56 calibre bullets still in the chamber. This Civil War relic was recovered near Tyne Blvd. and Battery Lane in Nshville. The Colt revolving rifle worked on the same principle as the Colt revolver. The rifles were issued to several Union infantry and cavalry regiments in the Western Theater of the Civil War.
